english_source: Sauti Sol is a Kenyan afro-pop band formed in Nairobi,[1] Kenya, by vocalists Bien-Aimé Baraza, Willis Chimano and Savara Mudigi in 2005.[2][3][4] Initially an a cappella group, guitarist Polycarp Otieno joined before they named themselves Sauti Sol.[5]
target1_text: Sauti Sol ni bendi ya afro-pop ya Kenya iliyoanzishwa mjini Nairobi, [1] Kenya, na waimbaji Bien-Aimé Baraza, Willis Chimano na Savara Mudigi mwaka wa 2005. [2] [3] [4] Hapo awali kilikua kikundi cha cappella, mpiga gitaa Polycarp Otieno alijiunga kabla ya kujiita Sauti Sol. [5]
target2_text: Sauti Sol ni bendi ya afro-pop ya Kenya iliyoanzishwa mjini Nairobi, [1] Kenya, na waimbaji Bien-Aimé Baraza, Willis Chimano na Savara Mudigi mwaka wa 2005. [2] [3] [4] Hapo awali kikundi cha cappella, mpiga gitaa Polycarp Otieno alijiunga kabla ya kujiita Sauti Sol. [5]

english_source: In 2008, she performed at the Nelson Mandela's 90th birthday concert in London and performed again at the WOMEX festival.[4]
target1_text: Mnamo 2008, alitumbuiza kwenye tamasha la miaka 90 ya kuzaliwa kwa Nelson Mandela huko London na akatumbuiza tena kwenye tamasha la WOMEX . [1]
target2_text: Mnamo 2008, alitumbuiza kwenye tamasha la miaka 90 ya kuzaliwa kwa Nelson Mandela huko London na kwenye tamasha la WOMEX . [1]

english_source: It was while preparations were being made for the centennial celebrations of the city of Kisumu, that Owíyo was requested to compose a theme song for the opening ceremony.

english_source: De Coque received international attention after performing in London in 1973,[1] and his guitar work was featured in Price Nico Mbarga's 1977 album Sweet Mother.
target1_text: De Coque alipata usikivu wa kimataifa baada ya kutumbuiza London mwaka wa 1973, [1] na kazi yake ya gitaa iliangaziwa katika albamu ya Price Nico Mbarga ya 1977 Sweet Mother .
target2_text: De Coque alipata kusikilizwa sana kimataifa baada ya kutumbuiza London mnamo 1973, [1] na kazi yake ya gitaa iliangaziwa katika albamu ya Price Nico Mbarga ya 1977 iliyoitwa Sweet Mother .

english_source: De Coque had at least four sons, including Solar De Coque, Safin De Coque (Darlington Akanite), Edu De Coque (Chinedu Akanite), and Ikenna Akanite.[1]
target1_text: De Coque alikuwa na angalau wana wanne, kutia ndani Solar De Coque, Safin De Coque (Darlington Akanite), Edu De Coque (Chinedu Akanite), na Ikenna Akanite. [1]
target2_text: De Coque alikuwa na watoto wanne, ambao ni Solar De Coque, Safin De Coque (Darlington Akanite), Edu De Coque (Chinedu Akanite), na Ikenna Akanite. [1]

english_source: Dee Doris is a Nigerian gospel musician, singer and songwriter.[1] She hails from Delta State, Nigeria and is an ordained deaconess in Christ Embassy.[2]
target1_text: Dee Doris ni mwanamuziki wa Injili wa nchini Nigeria, mwimbaji na mtunzi wa nyimbo. [1] Anatoka katika Jimbo la Delta, na ni shemasi aliyewekwa rasmi katika Ubalozi wa Kikristo. [2]
target2_text: Dee Doris ni mwanamuziki wa Injili wa Nigeria, mwimbaji na mtunzi wa nyimbo. [1] Anatoka Jimbo la Delta, Nigeria na ni shemasi aliyewekwa rasmi katika Ubalozi wa Kristo . [2]

english_source: Daisy Ejang is a Ugandan singer and was a finalist in the 6th series of Tusker Project Fame.[1] She has released several hit singles, including "Shuga" (a project with Levixone), "Yawa De", "Eyes On Me", "Incredible", "Love You Lord", "Fire" and "Teko". She collaborated with Prince Kudakwashe Musarurwa on the track "I Must Stick with You".[2]
target1_text: Daisy Ejang ni mwimbaji wa Uganda na alikuwa mshiriki wa mwisho katika mfululizo wa 6 wa Tusker Project Fame . [1] Ametoa nyimbo kadhaa zilizovuma, zikiwemo "Shuga" (mradi na Levixone ), "Yawa De", "Eyes On Me", "Incredible", "Love You Lord", "Fire" na "Teko". Alishirikiana na Prince Kudakwashe Musarurwa kwenye wimbo wa "I Must Stick with You". [2]
target2_text: Daisy Ejang ni mwimbaji wa nchini Uganda na alikuwa mshiriki wa mwisho katika mfululizo wa 6 wa mashindano ya Tusker Project Fame. [1] Ametoa nyimbo kadhaa zilizovuma, zikiwemo kama vile "Shuga" (akiwa na Levixone ), "Yawa De", "Eyes On Me", "Incredible", "Love You Lord", "Fire" na "Teko". Alishirikiana na Prince Kudakwashe Musarurwa kwenye wimbo wa "I Must Stick with You". [2]

english_source: Nayanka Bell (born 1963 in Agboville, Ivory Coast)[1] is an Ivorian singer who has released several albums, the earliest between 1982 and 1984.
target1_text: Nayanka Bell (aliyezaliwa 1963 huko Agboville, Ivory Coast ) [1] ni mwimbaji wa Ivory Coast ambaye ametoa albamu kadhaa, za mapema zaidi kati ya 1982 na 1984.
target2_text: Nayanka Bell (alizaliwa 1963 huko Agboville, Ivory Coast ) ni mwimbaji wa nchini Ivory Coast ambaye ametoa albamu kadhaa miaka ya 1982 na 1984.

english_source: In 2000, she recorded a version of Serge Gainsbourg's "Je t'aime... moi non-plus", with Congolese singer Koffi Olomidé and performed it in front of 17,000 spectators at the Palais Omnisports de Paris-Bercy.[3]
target1_text: Mnamo 2000, alirekodi toleo la Serge Gainsbourg " Je t'aime... moi non-plus ", na mwimbaji wa Kongo Koffi Olomidé na kuigiza mbele ya watazamaji 17,000 katika Palais Omnisports de Paris-Bercy . [1]
target2_text: Mnamo mwaka 2000, alirekodi toleo la muziki wa Serge Gainsbourg " Je t'aime... moi non-plus ", akiwa na mwimbaji wa Kongo Koffi Olomidé na kutumuiza mbele ya watazamaji 17,000 katika Palais Omnisports de Paris-Bercy . [1]

english_source: Georgette Adjoavi Bellow (Tsévié, Togo, 1 January 1945 – 10 December 1973) better known as Bella Bellow was a Togolese singer, who created an international career and recorded several albums. She died at the age of 28 in a car accident in Togo.[citation needed]
target1_text: Georgette Adjoavi Bellow (Tsévié, Togo, 1 Januari 1945 – 10 Desemba 1973) anayejulikana zaidi kama Bella Bellow alikuwa mwimbaji wa Togo, ambaye aliunda taaluma ya kimataifa na kurekodi albamu kadhaa. Alikufa akiwa na umri wa miaka 28 katika ajali ya gari huko Togo.
target2_text: Georgette Adjoavi Bellow (1 Januari 1945 – 10 Desemba 1973) anajulikana zaidi kama Bella Bellow alikuwa mwimbaji wa Togo, ambaye alitengeneza taaluma yake kimataifa na kurekodi albamu kadhaa. Alifariki akiwa na umri wa miaka 28 katika ajali ya gari huko Togo.

english_source: John Kasadha (commonly known as John Blaq (b. 16 July 1996) is a Ugandan musical artist, musician and entertainer. His style is primarily dancehall and afrobeat.[1][2][3][4]
target1_text: John Kasadha (anajulikana sana kama John Blaq 16 Julai 1996) ni msanii wa muziki wa Uganda, mwanamuziki na mburudishaji. Mtindo wake muziki ni dancehall na afrobeat . [1] [2] [3] [4]
target2_text: John Kasadha (anayejulikana sana kama John Blaq (b. 16 Julai 1996) ni msanii wa muziki wa Uganda, mwanamuziki na mburudishaji. Mtindo wake kimsingi ni dancehall na afrobeat . [1] [2] [3] [4]

english_source: Buchi Atuonwu, popularly known as Buchi, is a Nigerian reggae gospel artist. He started as a disc jockey in night clubs.
target1_text: Buchi Atuonwu, maarufu kama Buchi, ni msanii wa injili wa reggae kutoka Nigeria . Alianza kama mchezaji wa diski katika vilabu vya usiku.
target2_text: Buchi Atuonwu, maarufu kama Buchi, ni msanii wa muziki wa injili kutoka nchini Nigeria. Alianza kama Dj katika vilabu vya usiku.

english_source: Fatma Boussaha (Arabic: فاطمة بوساحة) (born January 22 1942 in Zaghouan - died October 27 2015) was a Tunisian Mezwed singer.
target1_text: Fatma Boussaha ( Arabic ) (amezaliwa Januari 22 1942 huko Zaghouan - alikufa Oktoba 27 2015) alikuwa mwimbaji wa Mezwed wa Tunisia .
target2_text: Fatma Boussaha, (alizaliwa Januari 22 ,1942 huko Zaghouan - alifariki Oktoba 27, 2015) alikuwa mwimbaji wanchini Tunisia .

english_source: Carver released her first single, It Don't Matter (1996)[1] when she was 17. The single topped the South African National Campus Charts. It spent 11 weeks on the South African National Top 40 Charts, where it peaked at the number three position.[citation needed] At age 18 she followed the single with her debut album, Mirrors and Windows (1998).[2]
target1_text: Carver alitoa wimbo wake wa kwanza, It Don't Matter (1996) [1] alipokuwa na umri wa miaka 17. Wimbo huo uliongoza kwenye Chati za Kampasi ya Kitaifa ya Afrika Kusini. Ilitumia wiki 11 kwenye Chati 40 Bora za Kitaifa za Afrika Kusini, ambapo ilishika nafasi ya tatu.  Akiwa na umri wa miaka 18 alifuata single na albamu yake ya kwanza, Mirrors na Windows (1998). [1]
target2_text: Carver alitoa wimbo wake wa kwanza, It Don't Matter (1996) alipokuwa na umri wa miaka 17. Wimbo huo uliongoza kwenye Chati za kampasi ya Kitaifa ya Afrika Kusini. Ilitumia wiki 11 kwenye chati bora ya nyimbo za Afrika Kusini, ambapo ilishika nafasi ya tatu.  Akiwa na umri wa miaka 18 alifuatisha nyimbo kadhaa na albamu yake ya kwanza, Mirrors na Windows (1998). [1]

english_source: Wunmi, real name Ibiwunmi Omotayo Olufunke Felicity Olaiya, is a singer, dancer and fashion designer.[1][2] She was born in the United Kingdom, to Nigerian parents, but spent much of her childhood in Lagos, Nigeria.[2]
target1_text: Wunmi, jina halisi Ibiwunmi Omotayo Olufunke Felicity Olaiya, ni mwimbaji, mchezaji dansi na mbunifu wa mitindo. [1] [2] Alizaliwa nchini Uingereza, kwa wazazi raia wa Nigeria, lakini alitumia muda mwingi wa utoto wake huko Lagos, Nigeria. [2]
target2_text: Wunmi, jina halisi Ibiwunmi Omotayo Olufunke Felicity Olaiya, ni mwimbaji, dansi na mbuni wa mitindo. [1] [2] Alizaliwa nchini Uingereza, kwa wazazi wa Nigeria, lakini alitumia muda mwingi wa utoto wake huko Lagos, Nigeria. [2]

english_source: She was part of the Argentina women's national football team at the 2008 Summer Olympics. On club level she played for San Lorenzo de Almagro.[1]
target1_text: Alikuwa sehemu ya timu ya taifa ya kandanda ya wanawake ya Argentina kwenye Olimpiki ya Majira ya joto ya 2008. Katika ngazi ya klabu alichezea San Lorenzo de Almagro . [1]
target2_text: Alikuwa ni sehemu ya timu ya taifa ya kandanda ya wanawake ya Argentina kwenye michezo ya Olimpiki mwaka 2008. Katika ngazi ya klabu alichezea klabu ya San Lorenzo de Almagro. [1]

english_source: Francis Bebey (French: [bəbɛ], 15 July 1929 in Douala, Cameroon – 28 May 2001 in Paris, France) was a Cameroonian writer and composer.
target1_text: Francis Bebey (Alizaliwa 15 Julai 1929 huko Douala, Kamerun na kufariki 28 Mei 2001 huko Paris, Ufaransa) alikuwa mwandishi na mtunzi wa Kameruni .
target2_text: Francis Bebey ( French: [bəbɛ], 15 Julai 1929 huko Douala, Kamerun – 28 Mei 2001 huko Paris, Ufaransa) alikuwa mwandishi na mtunzi wa Kameruni .

english_source: Charlotte Dipanda (born in 1985, Yaoundé, Cameroon) is a Cameroonian singer, who plays mostly acoustic music. Her lyrics are in French, her native language Bakaka, and in Douala.
target1_text: Charlotte Dipanda (amezaliwa 1985, Yaoundé, Kamerun ) ni mwimbaji wa Kameruni, ambaye hucheza zaidi muziki wa akustisk. Nyimbo zake ziko katika Kifaransa, lugha yake ya asili Bakaka, na Douala .
target2_text: Charlotte Dipanda (amezaliwa 1985, Yaoundé, Kamerun ) ni mwimbaji wa Kameruni, ambaye uimba zaidi muziki wa akustisk. Nyimbo zake uimba Kifaransa, lugha yake ya asili Bakaka, na Douala .

english_source: Eniola Aluko (born 21 February 1987) is a football executive, commentator, and former professional player. She is as of May 2021[update] the sporting director of Angel City FC in Los Angeles, US.[1]
target1_text: Eniola Aluko (alizaliwa 21 Februari 1987) ni mkurugenzi wa mpira wa miguu, mtoa maoni, na mchezaji wa zamani wa kulipwa. Mnamo Mei 2021 alikua mkurugenzi wa michezo wa timu ya Angel City FC huko Los Angeles, Marekani. [1]
target2_text: Eniola Aluko (amezaliwa 21 Februari 1987) ni mtendaji wa mpira wa miguu, mtoa maoni, na mchezaji wa zamani wa kulipwa. Yeye ni as of May 2021 mkurugenzi wa michezo wa Angel City FC huko Los Angeles, Marekani. [1]

english_source: Gitte Andersen (born 28 April 1977) is a Danish former football defender. She played for Brøndby IF and the Danish national team.
target1_text: Gitte Andersen (amezaliwa 28 Aprili 1977) ni mlinzi wa zamani wa kandanda wa Denmark . Alichezea Brøndby IF na timu ya taifa ya Denmark .
target2_text: Gitte Andersen (alizaliwa 28 Aprili, 1977) ni mlinzi wa zamani wa kandanda wa Denmark . Alichezea klabu ya Brøndby IF na timu ya taifa ya Denmark .

english_source: Dennis Nana Dwamena, better known as KiDi, (born August 18, 1993) is a Ghanaian high-life and afrobeats singer-songwriter. He is signed to Lynx Entertainment and is best known for his hit single Odo. The remix features Nigerian superstars Mayorkun and Davido and has received massive airplay across Africa.[1] KiDi won the coveted 'Artiste of the Year' award at the 2022 Ghana Music Awards[2] He also won top awards including Album of the Year and Most Popular Song of the Year[3]
target1_text: Dennis Nana Dwamena, anayejulikana zaidi kama KiDi, (amezaliwa 18 Agosti 1993) ni mwimbaji na mtunzi wa nyimbo wa Kiafrobeti kutoka Ghana . Amesajiliwa kwa Lynx Entertainment na anafahamika zaidi kwa wimbo wake wa Odo . Remix hii ina waimbaji nyota wa Nigeria Mayorkun na Davido na imepokea mchezo mkubwa barani Afrika . [1] KiDi alishinda tuzo ya 'Msanii Bora wa Mwaka' katika Tuzo za Muziki za Ghana za 2022 [2] Pia alishinda tuzo kuu zikiwemo Albamu ya Mwaka na Wimbo Maarufu Zaidi wa Mwaka [3]
target2_text: Dennis Nana Dwamena, anayejulikana zaidi kama KiDi, (amezaliwa 18 Agosti 1993) ni mwimbaji na mtunzi wa nyimbo wa Kiafrobeti kutoka Ghana . Amesajiliwa Lynx Entertainment na anafahamika zaidi kwa wimbo wake wa Odo . Remix hii ina waimbaji nyota wa Nigeria Mayorkun na Davido na imesikilizwa sana barani Afrika . [1] KiDi alishinda tuzo ya 'Msanii Bora wa Mwaka' katika Tuzo za Muziki za Ghana za 2022 [2] Pia alishinda tuzo kuu zikiwemo Albamu ya Mwaka na Wimbo Maarufu Zaidi wa Mwaka [3]

english_source: Osibisa are a Ghanaian-English Afro rock band, founded in London in 1969 by four expatriate West African and three Caribbean musicians.[1]
target1_text: Osibisa ni bendi ya muziki ya Afro ya Kiingereza-Ghana, iliyoanzishwa London mnamo 1969 na wanamuziki wanne wa Afrika Magharibi na watatu wa Karibea . [1]
target2_text: Osibisa ni wa Ghana - bendi ya muziki ya Afro ya Kiingereza, iliyoanzishwa London mnamo 1969 na wanamuziki wanne wa Afrika Magharibi na watatu wa Karibea . [1]

english_source: Dobble was a Ghanaian hiplife and highlife duo based in Accra, Ghana. The group is composed of Nana Kwasi Aryeh ("Paa Kwasi") and Gideon Edu Gyamfi ("Nana Yaw").[1][2] They won most popular song of the year with their hit song titled "Christy"[3] at the 2017 Vodafone Ghana Music Awards.[4][5]
target1_text: Dobble alikuwa mwana hiplife na highlife wa Ghana waishio Accra, Ghana . Kundi hili linaundwa na Nana Kwasi Aryeh (" Paa Kwasi ") na Gideon Edu Gyamfi (" Nana Yaw "). [1] [2] Walishinda wimbo maarufu zaidi wa mwaka na wimbo wao maarufu unaoitwa "Christy" [3] katika Tuzo za Muziki za Vodafone za 2017 za Vodafone. [4] [5]
target2_text: Dobble ni kundi la wana hiplife na highlife wa Ghana waishio Accra, Ghana . Kundi hili linaundwa na Nana Kwasi Aryeh (" Paa Kwasi ") na Gideon Edu Gyamfi (" Nana Yaw "). [1] [2] Walishinda wimbo maarufu zaidi wa mwaka na wimbo wao maarufu unaoitwa "Christy" [3] katika Tuzo za Muziki za Vodafone za 2017 za Vodafone. [4] [5]

english_source: Stephen Kwabena Siaw (born on the 1st of April, 1986), known by his stage name Ayesem, is a Ghanaian hip hop and hiplife recording artist from Takoradi. He is well known for his hit single, "Koti".[1][2]
target1_text: Stephen Kwabena Siaw (alizaliwa tarehe 1 Aprili, 1986), jina lake la kisanii Ayesem, ni msanii wa kurekodi wa hip hop na hiplife kutoka Ghana kutoka Takoradi . Anajulikana sana kwa wimbo wake wa "Koti". [1] [2]
target2_text: Stephen Kwabena Siaw (aliyezaliwa tarehe 1 Aprili, 1986), anayejulikana kwa jina lake la kisanii Ayesem, ni msanii wa kurekodi wa hip hop na hiplife kutoka Ghana kutoka Takoradi . Anajulikana sana kwa wimbo wake wa "Koti". [1] [2]

english_source: Buk Bak was a Ghanaian musical group composed of Prince Bright, Isaac Shoetan and Ronny Coaches. They rapped in Ga, Twi, and Pidgin, and were the first hiplife group in Ghana to be successful with Ga lyrics.[1]
target1_text: Buk Bak Ni kundi la muziki la Ghana lililoundwa na Prince Bright, Isaac Shoetan na Ronny Coaches . Walirap katika Ga, Twi, na Pidgin, na walikuwa kundi la kwanza la wanahiplife nchini Ghana kufaulu kwa maneno ya Ga . [1]
target2_text: Buk Bak lilikuwa kundi la muziki la Ghana lililoundwa na Prince Bright, Isaac Shoetan na Ronny Coaches . Walirap katika Ga, Twi, na Pidgin, na walikuwa kundi la kwanza la wanahiplife nchini Ghana kufaulu kwa maneno ya Ga . [1]

english_source: Brittany Amanda Baxter (née Timko) (born September 5, 1985)[1] is a Canadian retired soccer player who played professionally for five different clubs and earned 132 caps with the Canadian National Team.
target1_text: Brittany Amanda Baxter (née Timko) (amezaliwa Septemba 5, 1985) [1] ni mchezaji wa soka aliyestaafu wa Kanada ambaye alicheza kitaaluma kwa vilabu vitano tofauti na kupata mechi 132 akiwa na Timu ya Taifa ya Kanada .
target2_text: Brittany Amanda Baxter (née Timko) (alizaliwa Septemba 5, 1985) [1] ni mchezaji wa soka mstaafu wa nchini Kanada ambaye alichezea vilabu vitano tofauti na kushinda mechi 132 akiwa na timu ya taifa ya Kanada.

english_source: Desmond Kwesi Blackmore (born January 12, 1987), known by his stage name D-Black, is an anglophone hip-hop and Afrobeat musician and entrepreneur from Ghana.[1] He has been described as "a successful entertainment mogul"[2]
target1_text: Desmond Kwesi Blackmore (amezaliwa Januari 12, 1987), anayejulikana kwa jina lake la kisanii D-Black, ni mwanamuziki wa muziki wa hip-hop na Afrobeat na mjasiriamali kutoka Ghana. [1] Amefafanuliwa kama "mogul aliyefanikiwa wa burudani" [2]
target2_text: Desmond Kwesi Blackmore (amezaliwa Januari 12, 1987), anayejulikana kwa jina lake la kisanii D-Black, ni mwanamuziki wa muziki wa hip-hop na Afrobeat na mjasiriamali kutoka Ghana. [1] Amefafanuliwa kama Mwanamuziki aliyefanikiwa kwa burudani" [2]

english_source: Jane Awindor (born April 10, 1990),[1][2][3] better known by her stage name Efya, is a Ghanaian singer, songwriter, and actress from Kumasi. She is the daughter of Nana Adwoa Awindor, a filmmaker and celebrity host of the late television show Greetings From Abroad.[4] Efya got her first exposure to fame when she participated in the maiden edition of the Stars of the Future talent show.[5] She won the Best Female Vocal Performance category at the Ghana Music Awards in four succession, beginning in 2011. Moreover, she was applauded for her performance at the 2013 Africa Magic Viewers Choice Awards.[5]
target1_text: Jane Awindor (amezaliwa Aprili 10, 1990), [1] [2] [3] anayelikana zaidi kwa jina lake la kisanii Efya, ni mwimbaji wa Ghana, mtunzi wa nyimbo, na mwigizaji kutoka Kumasi . Yeye ni mtoto wa Nana Adwoa Awindor, mtengenezaji wa filamu na mtangazaji mashuhuri wa kipindi cha televisheni cha Greetings From Abroad . [4] Efya alipata umaarufu wake wa kwanza aliposhiriki katika toleo la kwanza la onyesho la vipaji la Stars of the Future . [5] Alishinda kitengo cha Utendaji Bora wa Mwimbaji wa Kike katika Tuzo za Muziki za Ghana katika mfululizo wa nne, kuanzia 2011. Zaidi ya hayo, alishangiliwa kwa utendaji wake katika Tuzo za Africa Magic Viewers Choice 2013 . [5]
target2_text: Jane Awindor (amezaliwa Aprili 10, 1990), [1] [2] [3] anayejulikana zaidi kwa jina lake la kisanii Efya, ni mwimbaji wa Ghana, mtunzi wa nyimbo, na mwigizaji kutoka Kumasi . Yeye ni bintiye Nana Adwoa Awindor, mtengenezaji wa filamu na mtangazaji mashuhuri wa kipindi cha marehemu cha televisheni cha Greetings From Abroad . [4] Efya alipata umaarufu wake wa kwanza aliposhiriki katika toleo la kwanza la onyesho la vipaji la Stars of the Future . [5] Alishinda kitengo cha Utendaji Bora wa Mwimbaji wa Kike katika Tuzo za Muziki za Ghana katika mfululizo wa nne, kuanzia 2011. Zaidi ya hayo, alishangiliwa kwa utendaji wake katika Tuzo za Africa Magic Viewers Choice 2013 . [5]

english_source: Gasmilla started his music career featuring artists while in Junior High school. While in senior high school, he became the first artist at Cold Eye studios. Gasmilla's first major single was "Aboodatoi".[citation needed]
target1_text: Gasmilla alianza kazi yake ya muziki akishirikiana na wasanii akiwa katika shule ya upili ya Junior. Akiwa katika shule ya upili, alikua msanii wa kwanza katika studio za Cold Eye. Wimbo kuu wa kwanza wa Gasmilla ulikuwa " Aboodatoi ".
target2_text: Gasmilla alianza kazi yake ya muziki akishirikiana na wasanii akiwa katika shule ya upili ya Junior. Alikua msanii wa kwanza katika studio za Cold Eye. Wimbo wake kwanza wa Gasmilla ulikuwa " Aboodatoi ".

english_source: Bi Yan (simplified Chinese: 毕妍; traditional Chinese: 畢妍; pinyin: Bì Yán; born 17 February 1984) is a Chinese footballer who played as a midfielder[1] and competed at the 2004 Summer Olympics.
target1_text: Bi Yan ( simplified Chinese ; alizaliwa 17 Februari 1984) ni mwanasoka wa Uchina ambaye alicheza kama kiungo wa kati [1] na kushiriki katika Michezo ya Olimpiki ya Majira ya 2004 .
target2_text: Bi Yan (alizaliwa 17 Februari, 1984) ni mwanasoka wa nchini China ambaye alicheza kama kiungo wa kati [1] na kushiriki katika michezo ya Olimpiki ya mwaka 2004.

english_source: He won Best Rapper and Hip-Hop song of the year at the 2017 Ghana Music Awards.[2] He has worked with Damon Albarn, Flea, Tony Allen, Erykah Badu, and is featured on five songs on the Rocket Juice and The Moon album.[3] He is the grandson of one of Africa's foremost ethnomusicologists and composers J.H. Kwabena Nketia.[4] In 2012, The Strand on BBC Radio tipped him as one of four acts to look out for in 2012.[1] In 2015 M.anifest's single "Someway bi" earned him a third-place honour in the International Songwriters Competition (ISC).[5] In the same year, The Guardian named M.anifest as "the foremost rapper on the continent.".[6] M.anifest currently divides his lifetime between Madina in Ghana and Minneapolis in the United States.
target1_text: Alishinda wimbo bora wa Rapper na Hip-Hop wa mwaka katika Tuzo za Muziki za Ghana za 2017. english_source: Ruff n Smooth is a Ghanaian-based music group made up of Ruff/Bullet (Ricky Nana Agyemang) & Smooth/Ahkan (Clement Baah Foh).[1] Although both have been on the music scene for a while, it was not till they formed an alliance that they both gained prominence. Prior to this alliance, Bullet was formerly known as Etuo Aboba (meaning Bullet) and Ahkan known as Osrane (meaning Moon).
target1_text: Ruff n Smooth ni kundi la muziki lenye makao yake nchini Ghana linaloundwa na Ruff/ Bullet (Ricky Nana Agyemang) & Smooth/ Ahkan (Clement Baah Foh). [1] Ingawa wote wawili wamekuwa kwenye ulingo wa muziki kwa muda, haikuwa hadi walipounda muungano ambapo wote wawili walipata umaarufu. Kabla ya muungano huu, Bullet zamani ilijulikana kama Etuo Aboba (maana yake Bullet) na Ahkan inayojulikana kama Osrane (maana ya Mwezi).

english_source: Melanie Lynn Booth (born August 24, 1984) is a Canadian retired soccer player. She last played for Sky Blue FC in the National Women's Soccer League and for the Canada women's national soccer team.

english_source: As of September 2012, Brogaard held the all-time appearance record for Brøndby with 327 across all competitions. Malene Olsen was in second place with 247. Having begun her career as a forward, before moving back into defence, Brogaard had scored 74 goals for the club.[1]

Akiwa ameanza kazi yake kama mshambuliaji, kabla ya kurejea kwenye safu ya ulinzi, Brogaard alikuwa ameifungia klabu mabao 74. [1]

english_source: Hannah Bromley (born 15 November 1986 in New Plymouth, New Zealand) is an association football central defender who plays in South Korea's WK League for Suwon. She has represented New Zealand on the senior national team as well as various youth national teams.

Ameiwakilisha New Zealand kwenye timu ya taifa ya wakubwa pamoja na timu mbalimbali za taifa za vijana.

Ameiwakilisha New Zealand kwenye timu ya taifa ya wakubwa pamoja na timu mbalimbali za taifa za vijana.

english_source: Nii Addo Quaynor (born January 19, 1982), better known by his stage name Tinny, is a Ghanaian Rapper. He was born in Osu, Ghana to Mr. Ricky Tetteh Quaynor and Naa Badu Quaynor. He is the last-born of their six children.[1] At the early age of eight, by singing and rapping at parties and funfairs, he got into the music industry. In 1994, he started performing at Fun-World, an entertainment program which was organized every Sunday at the National Theatre (Accra).[2] He has released five studio albums since his debut.
target1_text: Nii Addo Quaynor (amezaliwa Januari 19, 1982), anayejulikana zaidi kwa jina lake la kisanii Tinny, ni Rapa wa Ghana. Alizaliwa huko Osu, Ghana kwa Bw. Ricky Tetteh Quaynor na Naa Badu Quaynor. Yeye ndiye mzaliwa wa mwisho kati ya watoto wao sita. [1] Akiwa na umri wa miaka minane, alianza kuimba na kurap kwenye sherehe na, aliingia kwenye tasnia ya muziki. Mnamo 1994, alianza kutumbuiza katika Fun-World, programu ya burudani ambayo iliandaliwa kila Jumapili katika Ukumbi wa Kitaifa (Accra) . [2] Ametoa albamu tano za studio tangu mwanzo wake.

Mnamo 1994, alianza kutumbuiza katika Fun-World, programu ya burudani ambayo iliandaliwa kila Jumapili katika Ukumbi wa Kitaifa (Accra) . [2] Ametoa albamu tano za studio tangu mwanzo wake.

english_source: Pappy Kojo showed his interest and love for music at an early age. He took part in locally organized rap shows where he would rap to Obrafour, Tic Tac, Reggie Rockstone, and Lord Kenya. His biggest musical influences are Obrafour, The Shady Aftermath Camp and Michael Jackson. After leaving Ghana for Italy in 2004, his love for rap music grew even greater. He began covering popular songs and posting them on his YouTube channel.[4]
target1_text: Pappy Kojo alionyesha kupendezwa na kupenda muziki akiwa mdogo. Alishiriki katika maonyesho ya kurap kwa Obrafour, Tic Tac, Reggie Rockstone, na Lord Kenya . Mshawishi wake mkubwa zaidi wa muziki ni Obrafour, The Shady Aftermath Camp na Michael Jackson . Baada ya kuondoka Ghana na kuelekea Italia mwaka wa 2004, upendo wake kwa muziki wa rap uliongezeka zaidi. Alianza kufunika nyimbo maarufu na kuziweka kwenye chaneli yake ya YouTube. [1]

english_source: Julie Rydahl Bukh (born 9 January 1982) is a Danish former football midfielder who most recently played for Brøndby IF and the Denmark women's national football team. As well as teams in her native Denmark, Rydahl Bukh played for clubs in Sweden, Australia and the United States. She was described by UEFA.com as a technically gifted and creative left-sided attacking midfielder.[1]
target1_text: Julie Rydahl Bukh (alizaliwa 9 Januari, 1982) ni kiungo wa zamani wa kandanda wa Denmark ambaye hivi karibuni alichezea klabu ya Brøndby IF na timu ya taifa ya kandanda ya wanawake ya Denmark . Pamoja na timu za asili yake ya Denmark, Rydahl Bukh pia alichezea vilabu vya Uswidi, Australia na Marekani. Alielezewa na UEFA .com kama kiungo mwenye kipawa cha kiufundi na mbunifu wa safu ya mashambulizi ya upande wa kushoto. [1]

Pamoja na timu za asili yake ya Denmark, Rydahl Bukh alichezea vilabu vya Uswidi, Australia na Merika. Alielezewa na UEFA .com kama kiungo mwenye kipawa cha kiufundi na mbunifu wa safu ya mashambulizi ya upande wa kushoto. [1]

english_source: In March 2001 Rydahl Bukh made her senior international debut against Finland. She scored her first goal in her second appearance, the Danes' 2–1 defeat to Italy in their opening group game at UEFA Women's Euro 2001.[4]
target1_text: Mnamo Machi 2001 Rydahl Bukh alicheza mechi yake ya kwanza ya kimataifa dhidi ya Ufini . Alifunga bao lake la kwanza katika mechi yake ya pili, kichapo cha 2-1 cha Wadenmark 2-1 dhidi ya Italia katika mchezo wao wa ufunguzi wa kundi kwenye UEFA Women's Euro 2001 . [1]

english_source: In 1986, Rita decided to convert their former residence in Kingston into the Bob Marley Museum. She is the Founder and Chairperson of the Robert Marley Foundation, Bob Marley Trust, and the Bob Marley Group of Companies. She adopted 35 children in Ethiopia and has assisted over 200 children in Konkonuru Methodist School in Ghana.[2]

english_source: Samini has released seven studio albums, with all being highly successful on the commercial market. Samini's success and recognition began when his first single, Linda, was released and subsequently appearing on other successful singles by other artists.[1][2][3][4]

english_source: Livingstone Etse Satekla (born 5 March 1988), better known by his stage name Stonebwoy, is a Ghanaian Afropop, dance hall and reggae musician. He is the CEO of Burniton Music Group. He won the Best International Act: Africa category at the 2015 BET Awards and Artist of the Year at the 2015 Ghana Music Awards.[2] He is also a recipient of two Billboard plaques.[3] He has been described as the king of reggae and dance hall in Africa.[4][5][6] Stonebwoy is also an actor, having appeared in the movies Happy Death Day and My name is Ramadan.[7] He is a global ambassador for sanitation.[8] In September 2019, he was made the brand ambassador for Voltic Natural Mineral Water.[9] He is the brand ambassador of Tecno mobile in Ghana[10]. In 2022, he signed unto Universal Music Group’s Def Jam Recordings, and it's flagship Def Jam Recordings Africa.[11] He’s poised to make three albums under the label.
target1_text: Livingstone Etse Satekla (aliyezaliwa 5 Machi 1988), anayejulikana zaidi kwa jina lake la kisanii Stonebwoy, ni mwanamuziki wa Afropop wa Ghana, ukumbi wa dansi na mwanamuziki wa reggae . Yeye ndiye Mkurugenzi Mtendaji wa Burniton Music Group. Alishinda kitengo cha Muigizaji Bora wa Kimataifa: Afrika katika Tuzo za BET za 2015 na Msanii Bora wa Mwaka katika Tuzo za Muziki za Ghana za 2015. [1] Yeye pia ni mpokeaji wa mabango mawili ya Billboard . [2] Ametajwa kuwa mfalme wa reggae na ukumbi wa densi barani Afrika . [3] [4] [5] Stonebwoy pia ni mwigizaji, akiwa ametokea katika filamu za Siku ya Kifo Furaha na Jina langu ni Ramadhani . [6] Yeye ni balozi wa kimataifa wa usafi wa mazingira. [7] Mnamo Septemba 2019, alifanywa kuwa balozi wa chapa ya Maji ya Madini Asili ya Voltic. [8] Yeye ni balozi wa chapa ya Tecno mobile nchini Ghana [9] . Mnamo 2022, alitia saini katika Kikundi cha Muziki cha Universal Rekodi za Def Jam, na ni kinara wa Def Jam Recordings Africa . [10] Yuko tayari kutengeneza albamu tatu chini ya lebo hiyo. [1]

english_source: Helen's presence and contribution to the choir and music ministry in Kingsway International Christian Centre, (KICC) came at a crucial time when the church was becoming the fastest growing assembly in the whole of the UK. Under the ministry of her Pastor and teacher, Matthew Ashimolowo, several hundreds of unbelievers came to know Christ. In 1997, Helen's talents were stretched further when she became Music Coordinator at KICC's North London satellite church, directing a group of eight talented singers and musicians, and assisting with the co-ordinating of KICC's main 100 strong Mass Choir.[5]
target1_text: Uwepo na mchango wa Helen katika huduma ya kwaya na muziki katika Kingsway International Christian Center, (KICC) ulikuja wakati muhimu ambapo kanisa hilo lilikuwa kusanyiko linalokuwa kwa kasi zaidi nchini Uingereza. Chini ya huduma ya Mchungaji na mwalimu wake, Mathayo Ashimolowo, mamia kadhaa ya wasioamini wali mjua Kristo. Mnamo 1997, kipaji chaa Helen kilipanuliwa zaidi alipokuja kuwa Mratibu wa Muziki katika kanisa la satelaiti la KICC Kaskazini mwa London, akiongoza kikundi cha waimbaji na wanamuziki wanane mahiri, na kusaidia katika uratibu wa Kwaya kuu ya Misa 100 ya KICC. [1]

english_source: Abrahams started working as a singer with local bands in South Africa in the 1970s.[2] Abrahams participated in a gig in Swaziland as drummer for Sarah Vaughan and Nancy Wilson. In 1975 he moved to the United Kingdom, where he gained his recognition.

english_source: Babili Amos Shili, popularly known by his stage name Aymos is a South African singer-songwriter. He is best known for the hit single "Emcimbini" which was produced by Kabza De Small and DJ Maphorisa.

english_source: In 2020, he released a collaborative album with Mas Musiq titled Shonamalanga.[2] The album was nominated at the 27th South African Music Awards for best amapiano album and best duo/group of the year.[3]
target1_text: Mnamo 2020, alitoa albamu ya alioshirikiana na Mas Musiq iliyoitwa Shonamalanga . [1] Albamu hiyo iliteuliwa katika tuzo za muziki za Afrika Kusini kama albamu bora ya amapiano na kundi bora la mwaka. [2]
target2_text: Mnamo 2020, alitoa albamu ya kushirikiana na Mas Musiq iliyoitwa Shonamalanga . [1] Albamu iliteuliwa katika Tuzo za 27 za Muziki za Afrika Kusini kwa albamu bora ya amapiano na duo/kundi bora la mwaka. [2]

english_source: At the South Africa Music Awards (2008),[3] The First Tick was nominated for SAMA Awards, as the Best Urban Dance Album and his single "Umahamba Yedwa" as Record of the Year.
target1_text: Katika Tuzo za Muziki za Afrika Kusini (2008), [1] The First Tick aliteuliwa kwa Tuzo za SAMA, kama Albamu Bora ya Ngoma ya Mjini na wimbo wake "Umahamba Yedwa" kama Rekodi ya Mwaka .

english_source: Mercy Amoah popularly known as Ohemaa Mercy was born in Weija, Accra to Fantis parents, Mr and Mrs Amoah, from Abakrapa and Elmina respectively. She lived most of her young life in Koforidua. Ohemaa Mercy undertook her primary education at St. Peter's Anglican Primary School, Koforidua and secondary education at Ghana Senior High School, Koforidua. She continued to the S.D.A Teachers Training College, Asokore, Koforidua where she obtained her Teachers Certificate ‘A'.[1][2]
target1_text: Mercy Amoah almaarufu Ohemaa Mercy alizaliwa Weija, Accra kwa wazazi wa Fantis, Bw na Bi Amoah, kutoka Abakrapa na Elmina mtawalia. Aliishi maisha yake mengi ya ujana huko Koforidua . Ohemaa Mercy alianza elimu yake ya msingi katika Shule ya Msingi ya Anglikana ya St. Peter, Koforidua na elimu ya sekondari katika Shule ya Upili ya Ghana, Koforidua . Aliendelea hadi Chuo cha Mafunzo ya Ualimu cha SDA, Asokore, Koforidua ambako alipata Cheti cha Ualimu 'A'. [1] [2]
target2_text: Mercy Amoah almaarufu Ohemaa Mercy alizaliwa Weija, Accra kwa wazazi wa Fantis, Bw na Bi Amoah, kutoka Abakrapa na Elmina. Kwa kipindi kirefu cha ujana wake aliishi huko Koforidua . Ohemaa Mercy alianza elimu yake ya msingi katika Shule ya Msingi ya Anglikana ya St. Peter, Koforidua na elimu ya sekondari katika Shule ya Upili ya Ghana, Koforidua . Aliendelea hadi Chuo cha Mafunzo ya Ualimu cha SDA, Asokore, Koforidua ambako alipata Cheti cha Ualimu 'A'. [1] [2]

english_source: Dyers came from a musical family but taught himself music playing on the streets of Cape Town, and became known for his pioneering fusion of Cape jazz and goema. He performed alongside numerous other musicians, including Abdullah Ibrahim, Basil 'Manenberg' Coetzee, Robbie Jansen and Winston Mankunku.[2][3]
target1_text: Dyers alitoka katika familia ya wanamuziki lakini alijifundisha kucheza muziki katika mitaa ya Cape Town, na alijulikana kwa upainia wake wa kuchanganya muziki wa Cape jazz na goema. Aliimba pamoja na wanamuziki wengine wengi, wakiwemo Abdullah Ibrahim, Basil 'Manenberg' Coetzee, Robbie Jansen na Winston Mankunku . [1] [2]
target2_text: Dyers alitoka katika familia ya wanamuziki lakini alijifundisha muziki katika mitaa ya Cape Town, na alijulikana kwa uwezo wake wa kuchanganya muziki wa Cape jazz na goema. Aliimba pamoja na wanamuziki wengine wengi, kama vile Abdullah Ibrahim, Basil 'Manenberg' Coetzee, Robbie Jansen na Winston Mankunku . [1] [2]

english_source: QwameGaby is the stage name of Gabriel Kwame, a Ghanaian gospel singer and early proponent of the Ghanaian "Gospel" genre. He is employed by Tigo, a mobile network.[1]
target1_text: QwameGaby ni jina la kisanii la Gabriel Kwame, mwimbaji wa nyimbo za Injili wa Ghana na mtetez. Ameajiriwa na Tigo, mtandao wa simu. [1]

english_source: Tagoe Sisters is the name of a musical duo consisting of twins Lydia Dedei Yawson Nee Tagoe and Elizabeth Korkoi Tagoe. They have been singing in the gospel music industry since 1983.[1] In March 2021, the group was honored by the organizers of 3Music Awards in an event called the 3Music Women's Brunch.[2][3]

[1] Mnamo Machi 2021, kikundi kilitunukiwa na waandaaji wa Tuzo za 3Music katika hafla iliyoitwa 3Music Women's Brunch. [2] [3]

english_source: Are started singing from the age of two, she knew she would serve the Lord at a very young age and pursued it. Her parents told her that she started singing a few day before her first birthday, that made her considers herself a born singer. However, after deciding to follow her passion for ministry, Evangelist Bola Are started a music band called Bola and Her Spiritual Singers on June 26, 1973. In August 1977, she released her first musical album Baba Ku Ise.[6] As at 2014, Are had released over seventy albums.
target1_text: Alianza kuimba tangu akiwa na umri wa miaka miwili, alijua angemtumikia Bwana akiwa na umri mdogo sana na akafwata. Wazazi wake walimwambia kwamba alianza kuimba siku chache kabla ya siku yake ya kuzaliwa, ambayo ilimfanya ajione kama mwimbaji aliyezaliwa. Hata hivyo, baada ya kuamua kufuata shauku yake ya huduma, Mwinjilisti Bola Are alianzisha bendi ya muziki iitwayo Bola na Waimbaji Wake wa Kiroho mnamo Juni 26, 1973. Mnamo Agosti 1977, alitoa albamu yake ya kwanza ya muziki Baba Ku Ise . [1] Mnamo mwaka wa 2014, Are alikuwa ametoa zaidi ya albamu sabini.

english_source: Joseph Omo Ebhodaghe, (born June 20, 1979), popularly known as Joe Praize, is a Nigerian gospel singer, praise and worship leader, songwriter and music director who rose to popularity following the release of his hit song "Mighty God" off his debut album My Praise.

english_source: Reverend Patrick Henderson is a gospel keyboard player, songwriter and producer. He has written several songs in collaboration with Michael McDonald, playing on a number of his and the Doobie Brothers albums. Henderson has long associations with many other artists as well, including Leon Russell, Michael Bolton, Nils Lofgren and Freddie King. He won a Gospel Music Association "Dove Award" for Best Contemporary Gospel Record Song of the Year in 1990.[1]
target1_text: Mchungaji Patrick Henderson ni mpiga kinanda wa injili, mtunzi wa nyimbo na mtayarishaji. Ameandika nyimbo kadhaa kwa ushirikiano na Michael McDonald, akicheza kwenye idadi ya albamu zake na za Doobie Brothers . Henderson ana ushirikiano wa muda mrefu na wasanii wengine wengi pia, ikiwa ni pamoja na Leon Russell, Michael Bolton, Nils Lofgren na Freddie King . Alishinda tuzo ya Chama cha Muziki wa Injili "Dove Award" kwa Wimbo Bora wa Mwaka wa Rekodi ya Injili ya Kisasa mwaka wa 1990. [1]
target2_text: Mchungaji Patrick Henderson ni kicheza kibodi cha injili, mtunzi wa nyimbo na mtayarishaji. Ameandika nyimbo kadhaa kwa ushirikiano na Michael McDonald, akicheza kwenye idadi ya albamu zake na za Doobie Brothers . Henderson ana ushirikiano wa muda mrefu na wasanii wengine wengi pia, ikiwa ni pamoja na Leon Russell, Michael Bolton, Nils Lofgren na Freddie King . Alishinda Chama cha Muziki wa Injili "Tuzo ya Njiwa" kwa Wimbo Bora wa Mwaka wa Rekodi ya Injili ya Kisasa mwaka wa 1990. [1]

english_source: Gordon James Mote[1] (born October 25, 1970) is an American Christian country/Southern gospel singer, piano virtuoso, and worship leader. He was born blind. He has released eight studio albums. His album Don't Let Me Miss the Glory (2007) was his breakthrough on the Billboard charts.
target1_text: Gordon James Mote [1] (amezaliwa Oktoba 25, 1970) ni nchi ya Kikristo ya Marekani / mwimbaji wa nyimbo za Injili wa Kusini, mtaalamu wa piano, na kiongozi wa ibada . Alizaliwa kipofu. Ametoa albamu nane za studio. Albamu yake Don't Let Me Miss the Glory (2007) ilikuwa mafanikio yake kwenye chati za Billboard .

Ametoa albamu nane za studio. Albamu yake Don't Let Me Miss the Glory (2007) ilikuwa na mafanikio yake kwenye chati za Billboard .

english_source: Mote was born, on October 25,[2] 1970, in Gadsden, Alabama, as a blind person,[3] where he grew up in nearby Attalla. He attended both Jacksonville State University, where he spent the first three years of his music education, while he transferred to Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee, where he graduated with honors in music.[3]
target1_text: Mote alizaliwa, mnamo Oktoba 25, [1] 1970, huko Gadsden, Alabama, kama kipofu, [2] ambapo alikulia katika Attalla karibu. Alihudhuria Chuo Kikuu cha Jimbo la Jacksonville, ambapo alitumia miaka mitatu ya kwanza ya elimu yake ya muziki, wakati alihamia Chuo Kikuu cha Belmont huko Nashville, Tennessee, ambapo alihitimu kwa heshima katika muziki. [2]

english_source: Etta Cameron (Ettamae Louvita Coakley; November 21, 1939 – March 4, 2010) was a Bahamian–Danish singer.[1] She especially sang jazz and gospel, and left her mark in the Danish music culture through her entire career from her arrival in Denmark in the 1970s. She was made a Knight of Dannebrog in 1997.[2]

Alifanywa kuwa Knight of Dannebrog mwaka wa 1997. [2]

english_source: Abitor Makafui is a physically disabled Togolese female pastor, activist and gospel music singer.[1] In 2009, she was awarded the "Woman Leader" prize for her work in the Makafui foundation, a charitable non-governmental organization helping underprivileged children in Togo.[2]

[1] Mnamo 2009, alitunukiwa tuzo ya "Kiongozi Mwanamke" kwa kazi yake katika taasisi ya Makafui foundation, asasi ya hisani isiyo ya kiserikali inayosaidia watoto wasiojiweza nchini Togo . [2]

english_source: Sakhile Hlatshwayo (5 July 1998 – 9 August 2021), known professionally as Killer Kau, was a South African rapper, dancer and record producer best known for his hit song "Tholukuthi Hey".
target1_text: Sakhile Hlatshwayo (5 Julai 1998 - 9 Agosti 2021), anayejulikana kama Killer Kau, alikuwa rapper wa Afrika Kusini, dansi na mtayarishaji wa rekodi anayejulikana zaidi kwa wimbo wake wa "Tholukuthi Hey".
target2_text: Sakhile Hlatshwayo (5 Julai, 1998 - 9 Agosti, 2021), alijulikana kama Killer Kau, alikuwa rapa wa nchini Afrika Kusini, mcheza dansi na mtayarishaji wa rekodi aliyejulikana zaidi kwa wimbo wake wa "Tholukuthi Hey".

english_source: He first performed publicly at the Grahamstown National Arts Festival in 1995, and gained attention in the jazz world as a member of Moses Taiwa Molelekwa's band. In the following years he played with Hugh Masekela, Sibongile Khumalo, and Paul Hanmer. Khumalo had been dubbed "one of South Africa's most promising young saxophonists".[1]

Katika miaka iliyofuata alifanya kazi na Hugh Masekela, Sibongile Khumalo, na Paul Hanmer . Khumalo alijulikana sana kama "mmoja wa wapiga saksafoni vijana wa Afrika Kusini". [1]

english_source: Warsame Shire Awale (Somali: Warsame Shireh Awaale, Arabic: ورسمه شيري اوال) (c. 1951 – 29 October 2012) was a prominent Somali poet, playwright and songwriter. He was assassinated in Mogadishu, Somalia's capital, becoming the 18th media figure killed in the country in 2012.[1] Islamist militants Al-Shabaab (militant group) are believed to have been behind most of the murders.[2]
target1_text: Warsame Shire Awale ( 1951 – 29 Oktoba 2012) alikuwa mshairi mashuhuri wa Kisomali, mtunzi wa tamthilia na nyimbo. Aliuawa huko Mogadishu, mji mkuu wa Somalia, na kuwa mwanahabari wa 18 kuuawa nchini humo mwaka 2012. [1] Wanamgambo wa Kiislamu Al-Shabaab (kundi la wanamgambo) wanaaminika kuwa walihusika na mauaji hayo. [2]
target2_text: Warsame Shire Awale ( Somali , Arabic ) (c. 1951 – 29 Oktoba 2012) alikuwa mshairi mashuhuri wa Kisomali, mtunzi wa tamthilia na mtunzi wa nyimbo. Aliuawa huko Mogadishu, mji mkuu wa Somalia, na kuwa mwanahabari wa 18 kuuawa nchini humo mwaka wa 2012. [1] Wanamgambo wa Kiislamu Al-Shabaab (kundi la wanamgambo) wanaaminika kuwa walihusika na mauaji mengi. [2]

english_source: In 1963, he joined the police force, permanently moving to the capital, Mogadishu, in 1972. Shortly afterwards, he joined Heegan, a troupe associated with the Somali National Theatre.
target1_text: Mnamo 1963, alijiunga na jeshi la polisi, akihamia kabisa mji mkuu, Mogadishu, mnamo 1972. Muda mfupi baadaye, alijiunga na Heegan, kikundi kinachohusishwa na Jumba la Kuigiza la Kitaifa la Somalia.
target2_text: Mnamo 1963, alijiunga na jeshi la polisi, alihamia kabisa katika mji mkuu, Mogadishu, mnamo 1972. Muda mfupi baadae, alijiunga na Heegan, kikundi kinachohusishwa na Jumba la Kuigiza la Kitaifa la Somalia.

english_source: Sona Jobarteh (born 1983[1]) is a British multi-instrumentalist, singer and composer with Gambian roots. She is from one of the five principal kora-playing griot families of West Africa, and is the first female professional kora player[1][2] to come from a griot family. She is the cousin of the celebrated kora player Toumani Diabate, and is the sister of the diaspora kora player Tunde Jegede.[3]
target1_text: Sona Jobarteh (aliyezaliwa 1983 [1] ) ni mwimbaji na mtunzi wa Uingereza mwenye ala nyingi za Gambia . Anatoka katika moja ya familia kuu tano za griot za kora za Afrika Magharibi, na ni mchezaji wa kwanza wa kike wa kora [1] [2] kutoka kwa familia ya griot. Yeye ni binamu ya mchezaji maarufu wa kora Toumani Diabate, na ni dadake mchezaji wa kora wa diaspora Tunde Jegede . [3]
target2_text: Sona Jobarteh (alizaliwa 1983 [1] ) ni mwimbaji na mtunzi wa Uingereza mwenye asili ya Gambia . Anatoka katika moja ya familia kuu tano za griot za kora za Afrika Magharibi, na ni mchezaji wa kwanza wa kike wa kora [1] [2] kutoka katika familia ya griot. Ni binamu wa mchezaji maarufu wa kora Toumani Diabate, na ni dada yake mchezaji wa kora Tunde Jegede . [3]

english_source: Mohana Bhogaraju[1][2][3][4] is an Indian playback singer who has recorded songs in Telugu-language films.[5][6] She gained recognition with the song "Manohari" from the film Baahubali: The Beginning for which she won the Radio Mirchi–Mirchi Music upcoming female vocalist 2015 award in Telugu Cinema .
target1_text: Mohana Bhogaraju [1] [2] [3] [4] ni mwimbaji wa kucheza wa Kihindi ambaye amerekodi nyimbo katika filamu za lugha ya Kitelugu. [5] [6] Alipata kutambuliwa na wimbo " Manohari " kutoka kwa filamu ya Baahubali: The Beginning ambayo alishinda tuzo ya Radio Mirchi–Mirchi Music ya mwimbaji ujao wa kike wa 2015 katika sinema ya Telugu .
target2_text: Mohana Bhogaraju [1] [2] [3] [4] ni mwimbaji wa Kihindi ambaye amerekodi nyimbo katika filamu za lugha ya Kitelugu. [5] [6] Alipata kutambuliwa na wimbo " Manohari " kutoka kwenye filamu ya Baahubali: The Beginning ambayo alishinda tuzo ya Radio Mirchi–Mirchi Music ya mwimbaji ujao wa kike wa 2015 katika sinema ya Telugu .

english_source: Mohammed Sillah (born 8 February 1997), known by his stage name Saint, is a Gambian recording artist, songwriter and producer currently residing in Sweden. In 2015, he rose to fame in Sweden with the release of his debut single Chillin.[1]
target1_text: Mohammed Sillah (alizaliwa 8 Februari, 1997), anajulikana kwa jina la sanaa Saint, ni msanii wa nchini Gambia, mtunzi wa nyimbo na mtayarishaji anayeishi Sweden kwa sasa. Mnamo 2015, alipata umaarufu nchini Uswidi na baada ya kutolewa kwa wimbo wake wa kwanza wa Chillin. [1]
target2_text: Mohammed Sillah (aliyezaliwa 8 Februari 1997), anayejulikana kwa jina lake la kisanii Saint, ni msanii wa kurekodi wa Gambia, mtunzi wa nyimbo na mtayarishaji anayeishi Sweden kwa sasa. Mnamo 2015, alipata umaarufu nchini Uswidi na kutolewa kwa wimbo wake wa kwanza wa Chillin. [1]

english_source: Shweta Mohan (born 19 November 1985)[2] is an Indian playback singer. She has received four Filmfare Awards South for Best Female Playback Singer, one Kerala State Film Award and one Tamil Nadu State Film Award. She has recorded more than 700 songs for film music and albums in all the four south Indian languages namely Malayalam, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada in addition to the Hindi films and has established herself as a leading playback singer of South Indian cinema.
target1_text: Shweta Mohan (amezaliwa 19 Novemba 1985) [1] ni mwimbaji wa kucheza wa Kihindi. Amepokea Tuzo nne za Filamu Kusini kwa Mwimbaji Bora wa Kike anayecheza tena, Tuzo moja ya Filamu ya Jimbo la Kerala na Tuzo moja ya Filamu ya Jimbo la Tamil Nadu . Amerekodi zaidi ya nyimbo 700 za muziki wa filamu na albamu katika lugha zote nne za kusini mwa India ambazo ni Kimalayalam, Kitamil, Kitelugu, Kikannada pamoja na filamu za Kihindi na amejiimarisha kama mwimbaji anayeongoza wa uchezaji wa sinema ya Kusini mwa India .
target2_text: Shweta Mohan (amezaliwa 19 Novemba 1985) [1] ni mwimbaji raia wa India. Amepokea Tuzo nne za Filamu kama Mwimbaji Bora wa Kike, Tuzo moja ya Filamu ya Jimbo la Kerala na Tuzo moja ya Filamu ya Jimbo la Tamil Nadu . Amerekodi zaidi ya nyimbo 700 za muziki wa filamu na albamu katika lugha zote nne za kusini mwa India ambazo ni Kimalayalam, Kitamil, Kitelugu, Kikannada pamoja na filamu za Kihindi na amejiimarisha kama mwimbaji anayeongoza wa uchezaji wa sinema ya Kusini mwa India .

english_source: Boby Techi (Hindi: बोबी तेची) (born 9 January 1990) is an Indian indie pop-folk singer-songwriter and actor. At the K-Pop India Contest 2013, she was awarded LG SONGSTAR of the year.[1][2] As a singer, Techi has formerly collaborated with The Vinyl Records as the lead vocalist. Aside from her musical career, Techi has also branched out into acting. She made her film debut Stranger in My Land in 2014.
target1_text: Boby Techi (amezaliwa 9 Januari 1990) ni mwimbaji wa nyimbo za India na mwigizaji. Katika Shindano la K-Pop India 2013, alitunukiwa LG SONGSTAR ya mwaka. [1] [2] Kama mwimbaji, Techi amewahi kushirikiana na The Vinyl Records . Kando na kazi yake ya muziki, Techi pia amejikita katika uigizaji. Alifanya filamu yake ya kwanza ya Stranger in My Land mnamo 2014.
target2_text: Boby Techi ( Hindi ) (amezaliwa 9 Januari 1990) ni mwimbaji wa nyimbo za watu wa India na mwigizaji. Katika Shindano la K-Pop India 2013, alitunukiwa LG SONGSTAR ya mwaka. [1] [2] Kama mwimbaji, Techi amewahi kushirikiana na The Vinyl Records kama mwimbaji mkuu. Kando na kazi yake ya muziki, Techi pia amejikita katika uigizaji. Alifanya filamu yake ya kwanza ya Stranger in My Land mnamo 2014.

english_source: Usha was born into a Tamil family[5] in Mumbai in 1947.[6] Her father was Vaidyanath Someshwar Sami[7] who hailed from Chennai, in Tamil Nadu.
target1_text: Usha alizaliwa katika familia ya Kitamil [1] huko Mumbai mwaka wa 1947. [2] Baba yake alikuwa Vaidyanath Someshwar Sami [3] .
target2_text: Usha alizaliwa katika familia ya Kitamil [1] huko Mumbai mwaka wa 1947. [2] Baba yake alikuwa Vaidyanath Someshwar Sami [3] ambaye alitoka Chennai, huko Tamil Nadu .

english_source: MSCL is wholly owned by the Tanzanian Government via the Treasury Registrar and operates under the auspices of the Ministry of Transport.[1][2] Its share capital consists of 1,000 shares each with a nominal value of TSh 1,000. The company's head office is in the northern city of Mwanza at the shores of Lake Victoria.[3] It maintains two branch offices in Kigoma and Kyela; and liaison offices in Dar es Salaam and Kampala.[7]
target1_text: MSCL inamilikiwa kikamilifu na Serikali ya Tanzania kupitia Wizara ya Fedha na inafanya kazi chini ya Wizara ya Uchukuzi . [1] [2] Mtaji wake wa hisa una hisa 1,000 kila moja ikiwa na thamani ya kawaida ya TSh 1,000. Makao makuu ya kampuni hiyo yapokatika jiji la Mwanza kwenye mwambao wa Ziwa Viktoria. [3] Ina ofisi mbili za kikanda Kigoma na Kyela ; na ofisi za mawasiliano Dar es Salaam na Kampala . [4]
target2_text: MSCL inamilikiwa kikamilifu na Serikali ya Tanzania kupitia Msajili wa Hazina na inafanya kazi chini ya Wizara ya Uchukuzi . [1] [2] Mtaji wake wa hisa una hisa 1,000 kila moja ikiwa na thamani ya kawaida ya TSh 1,000. Makao makuu ya kampuni hiyo yapo kaskazini mwa jiji la Mwanza kwenye mwambao wa ziwa Victoria. [3] Inahudumia ofisi mbili za matawi Kigoma na Kyela ; na ofisi za mawasiliano Dar es Salaam na Kampala . [4]

english_source: Almitra's father was a businessman and her mother a civic activist, involved with an education society she had founded. Almitra’s was surrounded by science from an early age, and along with her cousin was the first girl to study science at Barnes High School.
target1_text: Baba yake Almitra alikuwa mfanyabiashara na mama yake alikuwa mwanaharakati wa kiraia, anayehusika na jumuiya ya elimu aliyokuwa ameanzisha. Almitra alizungukwa na sayansi tangu umri mdogo, na pamoja na binamu yake alikuwa msichana wa kwanza kusoma sayansi katika Shule ya Upili ya Barnes .
target2_text: Baba ya Almitra alikuwa mfanyabiashara na mama yake mwanaharakati wa kiraia, anayehusika na jumuiya ya elimu aliyokuwa ameanzisha. Almitra's alizungukwa na sayansi tangu umri mdogo, na pamoja na binamu yake alikuwa msichana wa kwanza kusoma sayansi katika Shule ya Upili ya Barnes .

english_source: Indira Chakravarty is an Indian public health specialist, scholar, environmentalist,[1] and 2014 recipient of the Padma Shri, the fourth highest civilian award by the Government of India, for her contributions to the fields of public health and environment.[2]
target1_text: Indira Chakravarty ni mtaalamu wa afya ya umma wa India, msomi, mwanamazingira, na mpokeaji wa 2014 wa Padma Shri, tuzo ya nne ya juu zaidi ya kiraia na Serikali ya India, kwa michango yake katika nyanja za afya ya umma na mazingira.
target2_text: Indira Chakravarty ni mtaalamu wa afya ya umma wa India, msomi, mwanamazingira, [1] na mpokeaji wa 2014 wa Padma Shri, tuzo ya nne ya juu zaidi ya kiraia na Serikali ya India, kwa michango yake katika nyanja za afya ya umma na mazingira. [2]

english_source: Chakravarty is from West Bengal and secured a doctoral degree (PhD) in Biochemistry from Calcutta University,[4] followed by a second doctoral degree (DSc).[2][5] She is active in the food safety and hygiene industry of India and globally, and has participated in 30 research projects.[4] She has also been involved with two projects of the World Health Organization (WHO), the World Summit for Children and the Hunger Project.[1]
target1_text: Chakravarty anatoka Bengal Magharibi na alipata shahada ya udaktari ( PhD ) katika Biokemia kutoka Chuo Kikuu cha Calcutta, ikifuatiwa na shahada ya pili ya udaktari (DSc). Anashiriki kikamilifu katika tasnia ya usalama wa chakula na usafi wa India na ulimwenguni kote, na ameshiriki katika miradi 30 ya utafiti. Pia amehusika na miradi miwili ya Shirika la Afya Duniani (WHO), Mkutano wa Dunia wa Watoto na Mradi wa Njaa .
target2_text: Chakravarty anatoka Bengal Magharibi na alipata shahada ya udaktari ( PhD ) katika Biokemia kutoka Chuo Kikuu cha Calcutta, [1] ikifuatiwa na shahada ya pili ya udaktari (DSc). [2] [3] Anashiriki kikamilifu katika tasnia ya usalama wa chakula na usafi wa India na ulimwenguni kote, na ameshiriki katika miradi 30 ya utafiti. [4] Pia amehusika na miradi miwili ya Shirika la Afya Duniani (WHO), Mkutano wa Dunia wa Watoto na Mradi wa Njaa . [2]

english_source: Born in Radnorshire, Mid-Wales, he attended his local comprehensive school before going on to read Politics at SOAS, University of London.[2]
target1_text: Mzaliwa wa Radnorshire, Mid-Wales, alihudhuria shule yake ya kina kabla ya kwenda kusoma Siasa katika SOAS, Chuo Kikuu cha London. [1]
target2_text: Mzaliwa wa Radnorshire, Mid-Wales, alihudhuria shule ya kata kabla ya kwenda kusoma Siasa katika SOAS, Chuo Kikuu cha London.

english_source: Ramesh Agrawal is an Indian social worker, internet café owner and grassroots environmentalist from Chhattisgarh. He was awarded the Goldman Environmental Prize[1] in 2014 for his efforts in organizing protests against certain industrialization plans in the region, and in particular informing citizens about environmental and social consequences of projected large-scale coal mining.[2]
target1_text: Ramesh Agrawal ni mfanyakazi wa kijamii wa India, mmiliki wa mkahawa wa mtandao na mwanamazingira kutoka Chhattisgarh . Alitunukiwa Tuzo ya Mazingira ya Goldman [1] mwaka wa 2014 kwa juhudi zake za kuandaa maandamano dhidi ya mipango fulani ya maendeleo ya viwanda katika eneo hilo, na hasa kuwajulisha wananchi kuhusu madhara ya kimazingira na kijamii ya makadirio ya uchimbaji mkubwa wa makaa ya mawe . [2]
target2_text: Ramesh Agrawal ni mfanyakazi wa India, mmiliki wa mkahawa wa mtandao pia ni mwanamazingira kutoka Chhattisgarh . Alitunukiwa Tuzo ya Mazingira ya Goldman mwaka wa 2014 kwa juhudi zake za kuandaa maandamano dhidi ya mipango fulani ya maendeleo ya viwanda katika eneo hilo, na hasa kuwajulisha wananchi kuhusu madhara ya kimazingira na kijamii ya makadirio ya uchimbaji mkubwa wa makaa ya mawe .

english_source: The conservation movement, also known as nature conservation, is a political, environmental, and social movement that seeks to manage and protect natural resources, including animal, fungus, and plant species as well as their habitat for the future. Conservationists are concerned with leaving the environment in a better state than the condition they found it in.[1] Evidence-based conservation seeks to use high quality scientific evidence to make conservation efforts more effective.
target1_text: Harakati za uhifadhi, pia hujulikana kama uhifadhi wa mazingira, ni vuguvugu la kisiasa, kimazingira, na kijamii ambalo linalenga kusimamia na kulinda maliasili, ikiwa ni pamoja na wanyama, kuvu na spishi za mimea na vile vile makazi yao kwa siku zijazo. Wahifadhi wanajali kuacha mazingira katika hali bora kuliko hali waliyoipata. [1] Uhifadhi unaotegemea ushahidi unalenga kutumia ushahidi wa kisayansi wa hali ya juu ili kufanya juhudi za uhifadhi kuwa na ufanisi zaidi.
target2_text: Harakati za uhifadhi, pia hujulikana kama uhifadhi wa mazingira, ni vuguvugu la kisiasa, kimazingira, na kijamii ambalo linalenga kusimamia na kulinda maliasili, ikiwa ni pamoja na wanyama wa nchi kuvu na spishi za mimea na vile vile makazi yao kwa siku zijazo. Wahifadhi wanajali kuacha mazingira katika hali bora kuliko hali waliyoipata. Uhifadhi unaotegemea ushahidi unalenga kutumia ushahidi wa kisayansi wa hali ya juu ili kufanya juhudi za uhifadhi kuwa na ufanisi zaidi.

english_source: Alvares is a member of the Goa Coastal Zone Management Authority of the Ministry of Environment and Forests (MoEF).[3] He is also a member of the Supreme Court Monitoring Committee (SCMC) on Hazardous Wastes constituted by the Supreme Court of India.[4]
target1_text: Alvares ni mwanachama wa Mamlaka ya Usimamizi wa Kanda ya Pwani ya Goa ya Wizara ya Mazingira na Misitu . Pia ni mjumbe wa Kamati ya Ufuatiliaji ya Mahakama ya Juu (SCMC) kuhusu Taka hatarishi iliyoundwa na Mahakama Kuu ya India .
target2_text: Alvares ni mwanachama wa Mamlaka ya Usimamizi wa Kanda ya Pwani ya Goa ya Wizara ya Mazingira na Misitu (MoEF). [1] Yeye pia ni mjumbe wa Kamati ya Ufuatiliaji ya Mahakama ya Juu (SCMC) kuhusu Taka hatarishi iliyoundwa na Mahakama Kuu ya India . [2]

english_source: Recent agricultural efforts in the area have led to a significant rise in the water table, which has caused a number of the site's buildings to collapse or become unstable. The site was added to the List of World Heritage in Danger in 2001. Authorities were forced to place sand in the bases of buildings that are most endangered in the site.
target1_text: Jitihada za hivi karibuni za kilimo katika eneo hilo zimesababisha kupanda kwa kiasi kikubwa kwa kiwango cha maji, ambayo imesababisha idadi ya majengo ya tovuti kuanguka au kutokuwa na utulivu. Tovuti hiyo iliongezwa kwenye Orodha ya Urithi wa Dunia ulio hatarini mnamo 2001. Mamlaka zililazimika kuweka mchanga katika misingi ya majengo ambayo yamo hatarini zaidi katika eneo hilo.
target2_text: Jitihada za hivi karibuni za kilimo katika eneo hilo zimesababisha kupanda kwa kiasi kikubwa kwa kiwango cha maji, ambapo imesababisha idadi ya majengo yamahali hapo kuanguka au kutokuwa na utulivu. Sehemu hiyo iliongezwa kwenye Orodha ya Urithi wa Dunia ulio hatarini mnamo 2001. Mamlaka zililazimika kuweka mchanga katika misingi ya majengo ambayo yamo hatarini zaidi katika eneo hilo.

english_source: Zawyet Umm El Rakham (Egyptian Arabic: زاوية أم الرخم lit. "the resthouse of the mother of vultures")[1] is an archaeological site located on the North coast of Egypt 20 km to the west of Marsa Matruh, and about 300 km to the west of Alexandria[2]
target1_text: Zawyet Umm El Rakham ( Egyptian Arabic lit. "nyumba ya mapumziko ya mama wa tai") [1] ni tovuti ya kiakiolojia iliyoko kwenye pwani ya Kaskazini ya Misri 20 km magharibi mwa Marsa Matruh, na karibu 300 km upande wa magharibi wa Alexandria [2]
target2_text: Zawyet Umm El Rakham ( Egyptian Arabic lit. "nyumba ya mapumziko ya mama wa tai") [1] ni eneo la archaeological linapatikana kwenye pwani ya kaskazini ya Misri 20 km magharibi ya Marsa Matruh, na 300 km upande wa magharibi ya Alexandria. [2]

english_source: During the reign of Ramesses II, it was the location of a major fortress-town which probably marked the western extent of direct Egyptian influence.
target1_text: Wakati wa utawala wa Ramesses II, palikuwa mahali pa ngome-mji mkubwa ambao pengine uliashiria kiwango cha magharibi cha ushawishi wa moja kwa moja wa Misri .
target2_text: Wakati wa utawala wa Ramesses II, palikuwa mahali pa ngome-mji mkubwa ambao pengine uliashiria kama eneo la magharibi lenye ushawishi wa moja kwa moja wa Misri .

english_source: It was discovered in 1948 and in the subsequent years was sporadically examined by Alan Rowe and Labib Habachi. Since 1994 extensive excavations have been undertaken at the site by a team from the University of Liverpool under the direction of Steven Snape.
target1_text: Iligunduliwa mwaka wa 1948 na katika miaka iliyofuata ilichunguzwa mara kwa mara na Alan Rowe na Labib Habachi . Tangu 1994 uchimbaji wa kina umefanywa kwenye tovuti na timu kutoka Chuo Kikuu cha Liverpool chini ya uongozi wa Steven Snape .
target2_text: Iligunduliwa mwaka wa 1948 na miaka iliyofuata ilichunguzwa mara kwa mara na Alan Rowe na Labib Habachi . Tangu 1994 uchimbaji wa kina umefanywa kwenye na timu kutoka Chuo Kikuu cha Liverpool chini ya uongozi wa Steven Snape .

english_source: Abe Bailey Nature Reserve is a protected area in Gauteng, South Africa. It is situated near Carletonville, beside the township of Khutsong on the West Rand. It is about 4,200 hectares[1] in size.[2]
target1_text: Hifadhi ya Mazingira ya Abe Bailey ni eneo lililohifadhiwa huko Gauteng, Afrika Kusini . Liko karibu na Carletonville, kando ya kitongoji cha Khutsong kwenye Rand ya Magharibi. Lina ukubwa wa hektari 4,200 [1] . [2]
target2_text: Abe Bailey Nature Reserve ni eneo lililohifadhiwa huko Gauteng, Afrika Kusini . Iko karibu na Carletonville, kando ya kitongoji cha Khutsong kwenye Rand Magharibi. Ina ukubwa wa hekta 4,200 [1] . [2]

english_source: Alfred Park is a small (8.4 ha) wetland swamp forest in New Germany, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa.[1][2] It is managed by the Ethekwini Municipality.[3]
target1_text: Hifadhi ya Alfred ni msitu mdogo wa ardhioevu (hekta 8.4) uliopo huko New Germany, KwaZulu-Natal, Afrika Kusini . [1] [2] Unasimamiwa na Manispaa ya Ethekwini . [3]
target2_text: Alfred Park ni msitu mdogo wa ardhioevu (hekta 8.4) huko New Germany, KwaZulu-Natal, Afrika Kusini . [1] [2] Inasimamiwa na Manispaa ya Ethekwini . [3]

english_source: The park is noted for its frog population, including reed frogs, various tree frogs, and the rare argus reed frog.[4] There are picnic areas and self-guided trails in the park.[2]
target1_text: Hifadhi hii inajulikana kwa idadi ya vyura wengi, ikiwa ni pamoja na vyura wa mwanzi, vyura mbalimbali wa miti, na vyura adimu wa argus . [1] Kuna maeneo ya picnic na njia za kujiongoza katika bustani. [2]
target2_text: Hifadhi hii inajulikana kwa idadi ya vyura wake, ikiwa ni pamoja na vyura wa mwanzi, vyura mbalimbali wa miti, na chura adimu wa mwanzi wa argus . [1] Kuna maeneo ya picnic na njia za kujiongoza katika bustani. [2]

english_source: The park is currently under threat from alien invasive species, especially the Pickerel weed, which has impacted the frog population.[5]
target1_text: Hifadhi hiyo kwa sasa inakabiliwa na tishio la viumbe vamizi, hasa Pickerel weed, ambao wameathiri idadi ya vyura. [1]
target2_text: Mbuga hiyo kwa sasa inakabiliwa na tishio la spishi ngeni vamizi, hasa gugu la Pickerel, ambalo limeathiri idadi ya vyura. [1]

english_source: Aloe Ridge Game Reserve is a game reserve and conservation park in central Gauteng province in north-east South Africa, lying some 15 kilometres directly north-east of the Sterkfontein caves. Located near Mulder's Drift it protects white rhino, buffalo, hippo, and many antelope and rare bird species. The reserve also has a Zulu craft centre and is open to tourists.
target1_text: Hifadhi ya Wanyama ya Aloe Ridge ni mbuga ya wanyama na mbuga ya uhifadhi katika mkoa wa kati wa Gauteng kaskazini-mashariki mwa Afrika Kusini, ipo umbali wa kilomita 15 moja kwa moja kaskazini-mashariki mwa mapango ya Sterkfontein . Iko karibu na Mulder's Drift, inahifahi wanyama kama vile faru weupe, nyati, kiboko, na swala wengi na spishi adimu za ndege . Hifadhi hiyo pia ina kituo cha ufundi cha Kizulu na iko wazi kwa watalii.
target2_text: Hifadhi ya Wanyama ya Aloe Ridge ni mbuga ya wanyama na mbuga ya uhifadhi katika mkoa wa kati wa Gauteng kaskazini-mashariki mwa Afrika Kusini, iliyo umbali wa kilomita 15 moja kwa moja kaskazini-mashariki mwa mapango ya Sterkfontein . Iko karibu na Mulder's Drift inalinda faru weupe, nyati, kiboko, na swala wengi na spishi adimu za ndege . Hifadhi hiyo pia ina kituo cha ufundi cha Kizulu na iko wazi kwa watalii.

english_source: Alverstone Wildlife Park is a 100 hectare nature reserve near Hillcrest, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa.[1] The reserve was created in 1997 by a group of neighbouring landowners.[2]
target1_text: Hifadhi ya Wanyamapori ya Alverstone ni hifadhi ya asili yenye ukubwa wa hekta 100 karibu na Hillcrest, KwaZulu-Natal, Afrika Kusini . [1] Hifadhi hiyo iliundwa mnamo 1997 na kikundi cha wamiliki wa ardhi jirani. [2]
target2_text: Hifadhi ya Wanyamapori ya Alverstone ni hifadhi ya asili ya hekta 100 karibu na Hillcrest, KwaZulu-Natal, Afrika Kusini . [1] Hifadhi hiyo iliundwa mnamo 1997 na kikundi cha wamiliki wa ardhi jirani. [2]

english_source: Blouberg Nature Reserve is a protected area situated close to Vivo, west of Louis Trichardt in the Limpopo Province, of South Africa. It covers an area of 9,360 hectares (23,100 acres) from the eastern portion of the Blouberg mountain range down to the savanna near the Brak River,[1] and is founded by Pieter Dix but was sold and now managed and administrated by the Limpopo Provincial Government.
target1_text: Hifadhi ya Mazingira ya Blouberg ni eneo lililohifadhiwa lililo karibu na Vivo, magharibi mwa Louis Trichardt katika Mkoa wa Limpopo, Afrika Kusini . Inashughulikia eneo la 9,360 ( kutoka sehemu ya mashariki ya safu ya milima ya Blouberg hadi savanna karibu na Mto Brak, [1] na ilianzishwa na Pieter Dix lakini iliuzwa na sasa inasimamiwa na kusimamiwa na Mkoa wa Limpopo. Serikali.

Ina ukubwa wa eneo la hektari 9,360 kutoka sehemu ya mashariki ya safu ya milima ya Blouberg hadi savanna karibu na Mto Brak, [1] na ilianzishwa na Pieter Dix lakini iliuzwa na sasa inasimamiwa na serikali ya Mkoa wa Limpopo.

english_source: The Bridle Drift Dam Nature Reserve is a reserve on the Bridle Drift Dam in the Wild Coast region of the Eastern Cape, South Africa.[1] The reserve lies on the southern bank of the Buffalo River next to the Fort Pato Nature Reserve.[1][2]
target1_text: Hifadhi ya Mazingira ya Bwawa la Bridle Drift ni hifadhi kwenye Bwawa la Bridle Drift katika eneo la Pwani ya Pori la Rasi ya Mashariki, Afrika Kusini. [1] Hifadhi hiyo iko kwenye ukingo wa kusini wa Mto Buffalo karibu na Hifadhi ya Mazingira ya Fort Pato . [1] [2]

english_source: Burman Bush is a nature reserve in Morningside, Durban, situated some 8 km north of the CBD. At about 50 hectares[1] it constitutes a small circular enclave of coastal forest which forms part of the Durban Municipal Open Space System (D'MOSS). It is the northern remnant of a forest that once covered much of the Berea ridge.[2] The reserve's elevation varies from 19 to 133 m a.s.l.[3]
target1_text: Burman Bush ni hifadhi ya asili huko Morningside, Durban, iliyoko takriban 8 km kaskazini mwa CBD. Kwa takriban hekta 50 [1] inaunda eneo dogo la duara la msitu wa pwani ambao ni sehemu ya Mfumo wa Nafasi Huria wa Manispaa ya Durban (D'MOSS). Ni mabaki ya kaskazini ya msitu ambao hapo awali ulifunika sehemu kubwa ya ukingo wa Berea . [2] Mwinuko wa hifadhi hutofautiana kutoka 19 hadi 133 m asl [3]

Ni mabaki ya kaskazini ya msitu ambao hapo awali ulifunika sehemu kubwa ya ukingo wa Berea . [2] Mwinuko wa hifadhi hutofautiana kutoka urefu wa 19 hadi 133 [3]

english_source: Caledon Nature Reserve is situated 120 km south-east of Bloemfontein on the R701 road between Wepener and Smithfield in the Free State, South Africa. It is about 2,300 hectares in size.

english_source: The Cape Henderson Nature Reserve, part of the greater East London Coast Nature Reserve, is a coastal forest reserve in the Wild Coast region of the Eastern Cape, South Africa.[1][2]
target1_text: Hifadhi ya Mazingira ya Cape Henderson, sehemu ya hifadhi kubwa ya mazingira katika pwani ya London Mashariki, ni hifadhi ya msitu wa mwambao katika eneo la pwani ya pori la Rasi ya Mashariki, Afrika Kusini. [1] [2]

english_source: The Kwelera Nature Reserve, part of the greater East London Coast Nature Reserve, is a coastal forest reserve in the Wild Coast region of the Eastern Cape, South Africa.[1] Access to the reserve is through the adjacent Kwelera National Botanical Garden, which the reserve now serves as part of the botanical garden.[2][3] The reserve stretches from the Kwelera River on the eastern side, to the Gqunube River (Gonubie) at the western end of the reserve.
target1_text: Hifadhi ya Mazingira ya Kwelera, ni sehemu ya hifadhi ya mazingira ya pwani ya mashariki ya London, ni hifadhi ya misitu ya mwambao katika eneo la Pwani la Pori la Rasi ya Mashariki, Afrika Kusini. [1] Ufikiaji wa hifadhi hiyo ni kupitia bustani ya Taifa ya Mimea ya Kwelera iliyo karibu, ambapo hifadhi hiyo sasa inatumika kama sehemu ya bustani ya mimea. [2] [3] Hifadhi hii inaanzia katika Mto Kwelera upande wa mashariki hadi Mto Gqunube (Gonubie) upande wa magharibi mwa hifadhi.
target2_text: Hifadhi ya Mazingira ya Kwelera, sehemu ya Hifadhi ya Mazingira ya Pwani ya Mashariki ya London kubwa zaidi, ni hifadhi ya misitu ya mwambao katika eneo la Pwani ya Pori la Rasi ya Mashariki, Afrika Kusini. [1] Ufikiaji wa hifadhi ni kupitia bustani ya Kitaifa ya Mimea ya Kwelera iliyo karibu, ambayo hifadhi hiyo sasa inatumika kama sehemu ya bustani ya mimea. [2] [3] Hifadhi hii inaanzia Mto Kwelera upande wa mashariki hadi Mto Gqunube (Gonubie) upande wa magharibi wa hifadhi.

english_source: The Zwartbosch Private Nature Reserve is a nature reserve in private hands in the Western Cape Province of South Africa.[1]
target1_text: Hifadhi ya Mazingira ya Kibinafsi ya Zwartbosch ni hifadhi ya mazingira binafsi iliyopo katika mkoa wa Rasi ya Magharibi, Afrika Kusini . [1]

english_source: North Park Nature Reserve is a protected area along the banks of the Umhlatuzana River, near Queensburgh in KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa.[1] The park was proclaimed in 1968 and is managed by Ezemvelo KZN Wildlife.[1]
target1_text: Hifadhi ya Mazingira ya Kaskazini ni eneo lililohifadhiwa kando ya Mto Umhlatuzana, karibu na Queensburgh katika KwaZulu-Natal, Afrika Kusini . [1] Hifadhi hii ilitangazwa mwaka wa 1968 na inasimamiwa na Ezemvelo KZN Wildlife . [1]
target2_text: Hifadhi ya Mazingira ya Kaskazini ni eneo lililohifadhiwa kando ya mto Umhlatuzana, karibu na Queensburgh katika KwaZulu-Natal, Afrika Kusini . [1] Hifadhi hii ilizinduliwa mwaka 1968 na inasimamiwa na Ezemvelo KZN Wildlife . [1]

english_source: The reserve protects riverine and coastal scarp forest, and is known for its birdlife[2] and butterflies.[3] There are a recorded 102 tree species in the reserve, with 48 considered rare.[3] Close to 160 bird species have been recorded,[1] including the Knysna Turaco and Purple Crested Turaco.[2]
target1_text: Hifadhi hii hulinda misitu midogo midogo ya mito na pwani, na inajulikana kwa wanyama, ndege [1] na vipepeo. [2] Kuna aina 102 za miti iliyorekodiwa katika hifadhi, na 48 ikizingatiwa kuwa nadra. [3] Kuna takribani spishi 160 za ndege zimerekodiwa, [3] ikiwa ni pamoja na Knysna Turaco na Purple Crested Turaco . [1]
target2_text: Hifadhi hii hulinda misitu midogo midogo ya mito na pwani, na inajulikana kwa wanyama wake wa ndege [1] na vipepeo. [2] Kuna aina 102 za miti iliyorekodiwa katika hifadhi, na 48 ikizingatiwa kuwa nadra. [3] Takriban spishi 160 za ndege zimerekodiwa, [3] ikijumuisha Knysna Turaco na Purple Crested Turaco . [1]

english_source: A number of small mammals can be found in the reserve, including blue and grey duiker, mongoose, hyrax and cane rats.[1]
target1_text: Idadi ya mamalia wadogo wanaweza kupatikana katika hifadhi, ikiwa ni pamoja na duiker ya bluu na kijivu, mongoose, hyrax na panya wa miwa . [1]

english_source: Modjadji Nature Reserve, also known as the Modjadji Cycad Reserve, is situated near Modjadjiskloof, Limpopo province, South Africa. The reserve has an area of around 350 hectares (860 acres). It encloses two steep ridges that are densely forested with the cycad Encephalartos transvenosus, the population of which is estimated at 15,000 individuals.[1]
target1_text: Hifadhi ya Mazingira ya Modjadji, pia inajulikana kama Hifadhi ya Modjadji Cycad, iko karibu na Modjadjiskloof, jimbo la Limpopo, Afrika Kusini . Hifadhi hii ina eneo la hektari 350. Inajumuisha matuta mawili yenye mwinuko ambayo yana misitu minene na cycad Encephalartos transvenosus, idadi ya watu ambayo inakadiriwa kuwa watu 15,000. [1]
target2_text: Hifadhi ya Mazingira ya Modjadji, pia inajulikana kama Hifadhi ya Modjadji Cycad, iko karibu na Modjadjiskloof, jimbo la Limpopo, Afrika Kusini . Inajumuisha matuta mawili yenye mwinuko ambayo yana misitu minene na cycad Encephalartos transvenosus, idadi ya watu ambayo inakadiriwa kuwa watu 15,000. [1]

english_source: Hiking along the trails in this nature reserve, it is common to encounter dassies, monkeys, bushpigs, impala, nyala, bushbuck and other antelope. The reserve has a picnic and barbecue area, information centre, and curio shop.[2]

english_source: The Nahoon Nature Reserve, part of the greater East London Coast Nature Reserve, is a nature reserve in the Wild Coast region of the Eastern Cape.[1] The reserve is located on the northern bank of the Nahoon River estuary.

english_source: The area of water at the dam has become a major breeding site for lesser flamingos since construction of an artificial island.[3] The dam and surrounding 380ha wetland area are designated as a conservation zone in the city's draft spatial development plan.[4] As of 2008 though, pollution and rezoning of nearby land for the proposed Northgate development became a contentious issue, with conservationists raising alarm.[4]

[1] Bwawa na eneo la ardhioevu la hekta 380 zimeteuliwa kama eneo la uhifadhi katika rasimu ya mpango wa maendeleo ya anga ya jiji. [2] Kufikia mwaka wa 2008 ingawa, uchafuzi wa mazingira na upangaji upya wa ardhi ya jirani kwa ajili ya maendeleo inayopendekezwa ya Northgate ikawa suala la kutatanisha, huku wahifadhi wakizua hofu. english_source: Augrabies Falls National Park is a national park located around the Augrabies Falls, about 120 km west of Upington[1] in the Northern Cape Province, South Africa. It was established in 1966.[2]
target1_text: Hifadhi ya Taifa ya Augrabies Falls ni mbuga ya Taifa inayopatikana karibu na Maporomoko ya Augrabies, takribani km 120 magharibi mwa Upington [1] katika mkoa wa Rasi Kaskazini, Afrika Kusini . Ilianzishwa mwaka 1966. [2]
target2_text: Hifadhi ya Kitaifa ya Augrabies Falls ni mbuga ya kitaifa inayopatikana karibu na Maporomoko ya Augrabies, takriban 120. km magharibi mwa Upington [1] katika Mkoa wa Rasi Kaskazini, Afrika Kusini . Ilianzishwa mwaka wa 1966. [2]

english_source: Addo Elephant National Park is a diverse wildlife conservation park situated close to Gqeberha in South Africa and is one of the country's 20 national parks. It currently ranks third in size after Kruger National Park and the Kgalagadi Transfrontier Park.
target1_text: Hifadhi ya Taifa ya Tembo ya Addo ni mbuga ya uhifadhi wa wanyamapori iliyo karibu na Gqeberha nchini Afrika Kusini na ni mojawapo ya mbuga 20 za Taifa . Kwa sasa inashika nafasi ya tatu kwa ukubwa baada ya Mbuga ya Taifa ya Kruger na Mbuga ya Transfrontier ya Kgalagadi .
target2_text: Hifadhi ya Kitaifa ya Tembo ya Addo ni mbuga tofauti ya uhifadhi wa wanyamapori iliyo karibu na Gqeberha nchini Afrika Kusini na ni mojawapo ya mbuga 20 za kitaifa . Kwa sasa inashika nafasi ya tatu kwa ukubwa baada ya Mbuga ya Kitaifa ya Kruger na Mbuga ya Transfrontier ya Kgalagadi .

english_source: Sodwana Bay National Park, is a park situated on the north western coast of KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa; it is located within the iSimangaliso Wetland Park World Heritage Site 20 minutes away from local town Mbazwana. This park is internationally renowned for its sport fishing, scuba diving and snorkelling.

Hifadhi hii inajulikana kimataifa kwa uvuvi wake wa michezo, kupiga mbizi kwa scuba na snorkelling.

Hifadhi hii inajulikana kimataifa kwa uvuvi upatikanaji wa scuba na snorkelling.

english_source: Wilderness National Park, also called the Wilderness Section, is located around the seaside town of Wilderness between the larger towns of George and Knysna, in the Western Cape.[1] It is a protected area of South Africa forming part of the Garden Route National Park.[1]

english_source: In 1968, the protection of the lakes in the Wilderness area was started through the identification of 450 hectares around the river mouth, including the two lakes as well as the Duiwerivier Kloof.[1] The Wilderness National Park itself was proclaimed in 1987, after being under the control of the Lake Areas Development Board until 1985, whereafter the National Parks Board took over.[1]

[1] Hifadhi ya Taifa ya Jangwani yenyewe ilitangazwa mwaka 1987, baada ya kuwa chini ya Bodi ya Maendeleo ya Maeneo ya Ziwa hadi mwaka 1985, ambapo Bodi ya Hifadhi za Taifa ilichukua nafasi hiyo. [1]
